      Constructs a new WarZoneState instance.

  • Method Details

    • getPenaltyIdx

      public Integer getPenaltyIdx()

    • getWorstPlayerState

      public Integer getWorstPlayerState()

    • getCurrShotIdx

      public Integer getCurrShotIdx()

    • isAllDone

      private boolean isAllDone(List<Integer> played)
      Checks if all the players are DONE for this penalty.
      Parameters:
      played - a list of integers representing the current state of elements to check.
      Returns:
      true if all elements in the list are equal to the constant `DONE`, false otherwise.

    • triggerNextRound

      private void triggerNextRound()
      Triggers the transition to the next shot within the current war zone state if specific conditions related to the worst player's state are met.

    • triggerNextPenalty

      private void triggerNextPenalty()
      Advances to the next penalty round within the current war zone state if all players have completed their actions for the current penalty.

    • countCrewMembers

      public void countCrewMembers(Player player) throws InvalidStateException
      Counts the crew members for each player in the current game state and determines the player with the fewest crew members to apply a penalty based on the current card's penalty type.
      Overrides:
      countCrewMembers in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - the player initiating the crew member counting action.
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - if it's not the player's turn or the action is invalid in the current state.

    • compareFirePower

      public void compareFirePower(Player player, List<Coordinates> batteries, List<Coordinates> doubleCannons) throws InvalidStateException
      Compares the firepower of the current player against others in the game and determines outcomes based on penalties described in the current game state.
      Overrides:
      compareFirePower in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - the current player performing the firepower comparison.
      batteries - a list of battery coordinates provided by the player; used to activate double cannons.
      doubleCannons - a list of double cannon coordinates provided by the player; used to calculate additional firepower.
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - if it is not the player's turn or the player performs an invalid action in the current state.

    • usePropulsors

      public void usePropulsors(Player player, List<Coordinates> coordinates, List<Integer> usedBatteries) throws InvalidStateException
      Compares the propulsion power of the current player against others in the game and determines outcomes based on penalties described in the current game state.
      Overrides:
      usePropulsors in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - the player performing the action.
      coordinates - a list of coordinates indicating the positions of the batteries used by the player.
      usedBatteries - a list of integers representing the number of batteries utilized for each battery storage.
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - if it is not the player's turn or the player performs an invalid action in the current game state.

    • removeCrew

      public void removeCrew(Player player, List<Coordinates> coordinates, List<Integer> numCrewMembersLost) throws InvalidStateException
      Removes a specified number of crew members from the player's ship based on the provided coordinates.
      Overrides:
      removeCrew in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - the player performing the action to remove crew members.
      coordinates - a list of coordinates indicating the positions on the ship where crew members are removed.
      numCrewMembersLost - a list of integers representing the number of crew members being removed at each coordinate.
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - if the action is invalid for the current game state, if the player is not the worst player, or if the number of crew members removed does not match the penalty requirements.

    • chooseBattery

      public void chooseBattery(Player player, int x, int y) throws InvalidStateException
      Handles the selection of a battery by the worst player during their turn to neutralize an attack with a shield or take a hit if no battery is used.
      Overrides:
      chooseBattery in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - the player attempting the battery selection.
      x - the x-coordinate of a battery on the ship or -1 if no battery is used.
      y - the y-coordinate of a battery on the ship or -1 if no battery is used.
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - if it is not the turn of the specified player or the action is invalid in the current game state.

    • fixShip

      public void fixShip(Player player, List<Coordinates> coordinatesList) throws InvalidStateException
      Removes the tiles of the player's ship based on the provided coordinates, ensuring the ship becomes legal. If the ship is successfully fixed, the player's turn for this round is marked as done. .
      Overrides:
      fixShip in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - the player attempting to fix their ship.
      coordinatesList - a list of coordinates representing the tiles on the ship to be removed.
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - if it's not the player's turn, the action is not valid in the current state, or the ship remains in an illegal state after removing tiles.

    • rollDice

      public void rollDice(Player player) throws InvalidStateException
      Rolls dices to determine the row or the column where the shot will hit. The result of the dice roll is used to determine whether the player's ship is hit, missed, or requires additional actions.
      Overrides:
      rollDice in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - the player performing the dice roll action.
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - if it is not the player's turn, or the action is invalid in the current game state.

    • anyWorstPlayer

      public boolean anyWorstPlayer()
      Determines if any player in the current game state holds the "worst" status.
      Returns:
      true if at least one player's state matches the "WORST" or "WILL_FIGHT" conditions.

    • updateView

      public void updateView(View view, Game toDisplay) throws IOException
      Updates the given view with the current state of the provided game object.
      Overrides:
      updateView in class GameState
      Parameters:
      view - the view instance that should be updated
      toDisplay - the game object containing the state to render on the view
      Throws:
      IOException - if an input or output exception occurs during the view update
